subject: Evaluation of RFQ and legalization of power of attorney in respect of foreign applicant member reg.
text: #Trt <efv TTHT w1fadrut TM9 /Phone : 91-11-25074100/25074200 (Ma wRaa7, Feo 4aa7t 37 7rtANf +3TT4) G48 / Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India QT. Extn:: 2223 2318 2468 2553 (Ministry of Shipping, Road Transport and Highways) #-5 & 6, #aer-10, ETGT; # farri}-110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka; New Delhi-110075 No.11041/218/2007-Admn. 25th August 2008 POLICY MATTERS TECHNICAL (17/8) SRCVLAR Sub: Evaluation of RFQ and legalization of power of attorney in respect of foreign applicant member reg: Consequent upon the discussions held in the 30th Weekly Meeting held on 20th August 2008 and with the approval of Competent Authority, it has been decided that in case of consortium involving Indian and foreigr applicant member; the Power of Attorney (POA) for signing of applications and for iecd member of consortium, if executed and issued overseas, then the document shall have to be legalized by the Indian Embassy in the country concerned and notarized in the jurisdiction Where the POA is being issued. However, any deficiency observed in POA at RFQ stage should nof render the applicants non-responsive and same may be insisted at the subsequent RFP stage. 2s108 (V.K . Sharmha) General Manager (Admn) Copy to PS to Chairman All Members All CGMs/CVO AII GMs/DGMs/Managers AIl PIUs/CMUs/SPVs also to Librarian/Hinidi Officer M { U Y NHAL Copy
